name: shoddily
content:
shoddily adverb
(BADLY MADE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is careless, of poor quality, and that uses low quality materials: These clothes are very shoddily made. Many buildings in the area are shoddily constructed.
More examplesFewer examplesThe government has promised an investigation into whether the school was shoddily built.The book was hurriedly put together and shoddily researched. The tunnel was shoddily made and collapsed after just three years.

shoddily adverb
(BADLY TREATED)
in a way that involves treating someone without respect, thought, or care: I've been treated very shoddily by the company. Everyone knows he was dealt with shoddily by the party. See
shoddy
More examplesFewer examplesI have never been treated so shoddily before.The Government has behaved shoddily, especially in its treatment of people who took the courses.They treat their customers very shoddily while demanding sky-high charges for inferior products.
